position.marginalia_text: Quia sicut ista sunt nigra & obscura respectu diei, sic corpus putrefactum, respectu corporis mundi, quod ex putrefactione oritur, seu per nostru[m] Artificiu[m] extrahitur. Sed cuius Coloris debet esse istud corpus mundum? Certe albi coloris: Vnde Hermes: &c

marginalia.translation: Because like these are black and obscure, But ought its colour to be the world body? Certainly it is white in colour, according to Hermes etc.

position.marginalia_text: Supra montem extensum in Cacumen, voce magna &c Ego sum Albus nigri, et Citrinus Albi, et Rubeus citrini: veridicus sum recte, et non mentior. Notetis ergo, Albus nigri: na[m] ip[su]m Album ex nigro extrahim[us]. Item Alphidius: Argentum viuum quod ab eo, s[cilicet] corpore nigro extrahitur, est humidu[m] Albu[m] &c

marginalia.translation: With strong voice over the mountain: I am the white of black and the yellow of white and the red of yellow. I am truthful and do not lie. Therefore, note the white of black, for the white itself is extracted from the black. Likewise Alhpidius says: mercury, because it is extracted from a black body, is wet white etc.

position.marginalia_text: Viso ergo quod primus motus Natura[e], est putrefacere, videndum est &c

marginalia.translation: Therefore it's shown because the prime motion of nature is putrefying, it seems etc.
